    Notes on Jason Fridley's Talk at ESA 2011

    • Evolutionary imbalance hypothesis (EIH):
      • Evolution is contingent and imperfect
      • Ecological optimization is rarely/never achieved
      • Similar ecological niches occur around the world
    • Inspired by MacArthur (1972)
    • Lots of ecological and evolutionary traits that may predict why one biota may overtake another  – but Jason suggests just use phylogenetic diversity as a proxy for these traits that are hard to measure
    • Question: In a destination region, is the invasability of the source regions related to the phylogenetic diversity of those regions?
    • Answer:
      • In Eastern Deciduous forests: proportion invasive species is positively related to phylogenetic diversity (PD)
      • In Mediterranean California: proportion invasive species is positively related to phylogenetic diversity (PD)
      • In Czech Republic: proportion invasive species is positively related to phylogenetic diversity (PD)
      • In New Zealand: No relationship between proportion invasive species and phylogenetic diversity (PD)
